comments: See A189683 for pairs (p,2n) for the primes p in this sequence.
links: T. D. Noe and Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..154 (first 66 terms are from T. D. Noe.)
Hisanori Mishima, WIFC (World Integer Factorization Center)
prog: (Macsyma) for n do for p in map('first,factor_number(abs(num(bern(2*n))))) do if p>=2*n+3 then (?prin1(p),?prin1('?\-));
author: _Bill Gosper_
